member.name: T:Microsoft.Marketplace.Storefront.Configuration.EnvironmentDefinition
member.summary: Represents the configuration necessary to operate in an environment.
member.remarks: This class should only contain members that differ from environment to environment. When something doesn't vary, it should not be present in this class, and instead should be a compile-time constant. If a property is no longer used, or no longer varies, it should be removed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Marketplace.Storefront.StoreEdgeFD.BusinessLogic.Aggregation.Detokenizer.StringDetokenizer.KeyValueRegexPool
member.summary: Regular expression to parse out tokens that are of the format "name={value}". These reside in the query string and should be stripped out completely (including the key) if the value is null to keep the resulting semantics consistent. When we strip out a key-value pair from a query string due to a null value, we also need to remove the trailing ampersand if one exists.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Marketplace.Storefront.StoreEdgeFD.BusinessLogic.Aggregation.Detokenizer.StringDetokenizer.ClientTokenRegex
member.summary: Regular expression to parse out client tokens, that is, tokens that we don't know how to fill out on the service. We transform these tokens into regular tokens as part of detokenization, for the client to fill them out. Client tokens are of the format "{{token}}" e.g. "/channels/products/{{productId}}" transforms into "/channels/products/{productId}"

member.name: F:Microsoft.Marketplace.Storefront.StoreEdgeFD.BusinessLogic.Aggregation.Detokenizer.StringDetokenizer.TokenRegexPool
M:Microsoft.Marketplace.Storefront.StoreEdgeFD.BusinessLogic.Aggregation.Detokenizer.StringDetokenizer.DetokenizeNameEqualsValue(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Name equals value ("name={value}") format can only occur in the query string, so we need to handle stripping out extra ampersands to keep the query string valid. This should only strip out the query string parameter when the query value is a token with no prefix or postfix. This is handled by the regex.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Marketplace.Storefront.StoreEdgeFD.BusinessLogic.Aggregation.Detokenizer.StringDetokenizer.AddToken(System.Text.StringBuilder,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a token to the sb string if the new token is not already present
member.returns: A new sb string composed of the original string plus the new token

member.name: T:Microsoft.Marketplace.Storefront.StoreEdgeFD.BusinessLogic.Aggregation.RegexPool
member.summary: Pools regex objects. Useful for highly concurrent environments, because Regex class performs poorly when used by many threads at once.

member.summary: Check if the version meets max version rule. If not the caller could forward the client to later version services.
member.returns: True if and only if the given version is no greater. If the rule contains no max version, then it returns true.

member.summary: Helper to resolve OemId and ScmId from Reg keys on device
member.param: Current values on device that will help determine final OemId and Scmid
ProvidersManager object with a reference to the MasterData Provider
The logging context of the caller
member.returns: A OemDiscoveryResponseBody

member.summary: Tries to resolve OemId in the follow order 1. Checks to see if OemId exists in the request, then tries to fix the value. If can't be fixed, use the original value 2. If ScmId exists in the request, then try to resolve Oemid from ScmID. If unable resolve, continue 3. If Oem ID can be resolved from PhoneManufacturerName. If unable resolve, continue 4. If Oem Id can be resolved from SmBiosManufacturerName.
member.param: OemDisocery request with potential OemId filled out

member.summary: Tries to resolve the ScmId in the follow order 1. If ScmId exists in the request, do nothing. 2. If ScmId can be resolved from PhoneDeviceModel. If unable resolve, continue 3. If ScmId can be resolved from SmBiosDm
member.param: OemDisocery request with potential ScmId filled out

member.name: M:Microsoft.Marketplace.Storefront.StoreEdgeFD.BusinessLogic.Utils.StoreUser.GetBusinessCatalogs(System.Version,System.UInt64,System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets Business catalogs the user has access to. Note: this function is to query M$ for the Business catalogs. We will always do the query if this user object hasn't done so as an interim solution before client can exchange the information back to service with proper TTL handling (catalog info is cleared when it detects AAD token expiration, etc.). But we will always recreate the CatalogInfoSet from the manifests because it is relatively cheap, as opposed to CreateCatalogInfoSetFromManifests, which will return the cached CatalogInfoSet, because it is called by GetCatalogInfoSet, which may be needed in many code paths.
member.param: the caller's device family version, which is the os version
the catalog languages of the user
A cancellation token (invoked if the request takes too long)
member.returns: The object that contains Business catalogs the user has access to.

member.summary:
Generate the ChartResults title from the given listname, category, and subCategory.
If there is only a listname, use that as the title. E.g. 'Top Free' If there is a listname and category, use both separated by a dot. E.g. 'Top Free Education' If there is a listname, category, and subcategory, use only the listname and subcategory separated by a dot. E.g. 'Top Free Math Games'
member.returns: The ChartResults title

member.summary: Returns data that has at least some aspects that are specific to the calling user or client (e.g. age or hardware based decisions)

The correlationId is defined by the client to be able to correlate all traces for a logical operation. Several calls to the service can use the same correlationId.
The requestId is defined by the client to be able to correlate all traces for a specific service request. For each call to the service the client generates a new unique identifier.
specifies the client type and version. For example: WindowsStore/2014.12.4.65530 (required if not provided in appVersion query string parameter)
member.queryParam: Market code of the request. For example: us
Xbox Live Music Market code of the request. This will override the market parameter for song and album searches. For example: us
Locale of the request. For example: en-US
The source device type. Either "w" for desktop, "wp" for windows phone, or "wa" for windows analog.
device family of the calling client, "Windows.Desktop","Windows.Mobile","Windows.Holographic", etc...
decimal representation of the version of the device family of the calling client, for example "1688858450264064" which equals "0x0006 0002 0001 0000" which means "6.2.1"
Whether or not to use stub data.
version of the store client. For example: 2014.8.1.1 (Required if not specified in User-Agent HTTP header)
what the user has started to type
member.returns: data that has at least some aspects that are specigic to the calling user or client (e.g. age or hardware based decisions)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Marketplace.Storefront.StoreEdgeFD.Controllers.V3.AutoSuggestControllerV5.GetSuggestions
member.summary: Returns suggestions based on what the user has started to type
member.remarks: Currently stubbed to always return empty lists
member.header: Specifies which version of the contract the client is targeting.
The correlationId is defined by the client to be able to correlate all traces for a logical operation. Several calls to the service can use the same correlationId.
The requestId is defined by the client to be able to correlate all traces for a specific service request. For each call to the service the client generates a new unique identifier.
specifies the client type and version. For example: WindowsStore/2014.12.4.65530 (required if not provided in appVersion query string parameter)
member.queryParam: Market code of the request. For example: us
Xbox Live Music Market code of the request. This will override the market parameter for song and album searches. For example: us
Locale of the request. For example: en-US
The source device type. Either "w" for desktop, "wp" for windows phone, or "wa" for windows analog.
device family of the calling client, "Windows.Desktop","Windows.Mobile","Windows.Holographic", etc...
decimal representation of the version of the device family of the calling client, for example "1688858450264064" which equals "0x0006 0002 0001 0000" which means "6.2.1"
Whether or not to use stub data.
version of the store client. For example: 2014.8.1.1 (Required if not specified in User-Agent HTTP header)
what the user has started to type
member.returns: AutoSuggestions object which contains a collection of ProductSummary objects and a collection of strings for suggested searches

member.header: Specifies which version of the contract the client is targeting.

specifies the client type and version. For example: WindowsStore/2014.12.4.65530 (required if not provided in appVersion query string parameter)

Locale of the request. For example: en-US
The source device type. Either "w" for desktop, "wp" for windows phone, or "wa" for windows analog.
device family of the calling client, "Windows.Desktop","Windows.Mobile","Windows.Holographic", etc...
decimal representation of the version of the device family of the calling client, for example "1688858450264064" which equals "0x0006 0002 0001 0000" which means "6.2.1"
Whether or not to use stub data.
version of the store client. For example: 2014.8.1.1 (Required if not specified in User-Agent HTTP header)
what the user has started to type

member.name: P:Microsoft.Marketplace.Storefront.StoreEdgeFD.Providers.Purchase.Contracts.Request.CreateOrderRequestV6.OrderState
member.summary: Gets or sets the state of the order. The valid states are: Order StateDescriptionEditingThis is the default value if none is specified. CheckingOut This will result in the order being submitted for check out with taxes and final pricing being calculated. There must be at least one item specified before checking out. Pending More actions must be taken before the order can be moved to the Purchased state. Purchased This will result in the order being submitted for purchase. There must be at least one item specified before purchase.
